description: This notification is sent when a PBB-TE tunnel of the given tunnel group
is activated. A tunnel is said to be activated when its forwarding
state becomes enabled. To send this trap, the SNMP global trap state
'cienaCesPbtFaultTrapState' needs to be set to enabled. This state is
'enabled' by default. Variable bindings include: cienaGlobalSeverity,
cienaGlobalMacAddress, cienaCesPbtEncapTnlNotifIndex,
cienaCesPbtEncapTnlName, cienaCesPbtTnlGroupIndex, cienaCesPbtTnlGroupName,
cienaCesPbtEncapTnlFwdState, and cienaCesPbtEncapTnlBvid.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtTunnelActivateNotification CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity i 1 CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlNotifIndex u 9999 CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlName s EXAMPLE CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtTnlGroupIndex u 9999 CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtTnlGroupName s EXAMPLE CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlFwdState i 1 CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlBvid u 9999

description: This object defines the severity of a trap and is a part of every trap defined in the system.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity

description: This object indicates the chassis MAC address.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress

description: This object represents the unique index in the table used in the trap definition.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlNotifIndex

description: This object represents the PBB-TE encap tunnel name.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlName

description: This object represents the unique index in the PBB-TE tunnel group table.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtTnlGroupIndex

description: This object represents the PBB-TE tunnel group name.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtTnlGroupName

description: This object represents the forwarding state of the PBB-TE encap tunnel.
If an encap tunnel is made the active tunnel, the decap tunnel that is
paired (if any) with it is implicitly be the active decap tunnel.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlFwdState

description: This object represents the B-VID value of the PBB-TE encap tunnel. A group of VIDs
are reserved for PBB-TE. The range is 1-4094. However, the same B-VID can be used
to set up multiple tunnels provided the destination MAC is different for each tunnel.
<B-DA,B-VID>, where B-DA is the remote MAC address, is unique.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlBvid

description: This notification is sent when a PBB-TE tunnel of the given tunnel group
is deactivated. A tunnel is said to be deactivated when its forwarding
state becomes disabled. To send this trap, the SNMP global trap state
'cienaCesPbtFaultTrapState' needs to be set to enabled. This state is 'enabled'
by default. Variable bindings include: cienaGlobalSeverity, cienaGlobalMacAddress
cienaCesPbtEncapTnlNotifIndex, cienaCesPbtEncapTnlName, cienaCesPbtTnlGroupIndex,
cienaCesPbtTnlGroupName, cienaCesPbtEncapTnlFwdState, and cienaCesPbtEncapTnlBvid.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtTunnelDeactivateNotification CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity i 5 CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlNotifIndex u 9999 CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlName s EXAMPLE CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtTnlGroupIndex u 9999 CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtTnlGroupName s EXAMPLE CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlFwdState i 1 CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlBvid u 9999

description: This object defines the severity of a trap and is a part of every trap defined in the system.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity

description: This object indicates the chassis MAC address.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress

description: This object represents the unique index in the table used in the trap definition.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlNotifIndex

description: This object represents the PBB-TE encap tunnel name.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlName

description: This object represents the unique index in the PBB-TE tunnel group table.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtTnlGroupIndex

description: This object represents the PBB-TE tunnel group name.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtTnlGroupName

description: This object represents the forwarding state of the PBB-TE encap tunnel.
If an encap tunnel is made the active tunnel, the decap tunnel that is
paired (if any) with it is implicitly be the active decap tunnel.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlFwdState

description: This object represents the B-VID value of the PBB-TE encap tunnel. A group of VIDs
are reserved for PBB-TE. The range is 1-4094. However, the same B-VID can be used
to set up multiple tunnels provided the destination MAC is different for each tunnel.
<B-DA,B-VID>, where B-DA is the remote MAC address, is unique.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlBvid

description: Upon failure of the primary tunnel, traffic is moved over to the backup
tunnel at the tunnel ingress. Tunnel reversion signifies the restoration of
traffic from this backup tunnel (now active) to the primary (now standby)
after the primary tunnel is restored. This notification is generated when
this reversion occurs. To send this trap, the SNMP global trap state
'cienaCesPbtFaultTrapState' needs to be set to enabled. This state is 'enabled'
by default. Variable bindings include: cienaGlobalSeverity, cienaGlobalMacAddress,
cienaCesPbtTnlGroupIndex, cienaCesPbtTnlGroupName,
cienaCesPbtEncapTnlReversionToPairIndex, and cienaCesPbtEncapTnlReversionFromPairIndex.

event.Summary: Primary tunnel restored in tunnel group $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtTunnelReversionNotification CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity i 8 CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtTnlGroupIndex u 9999 CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtTnlGroupName s EXAMPLE CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlReversionToPairIndex u 9999 CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlReversionFromPairIndex u 9999

description: This object defines the severity of a trap and is a part of every trap defined in the system.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity

description: This object indicates the chassis MAC address.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress

description: This object represents the unique index in the PBB-TE tunnel group table.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtTnlGroupIndex

description: This object represents the PBB-TE tunnel group name.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtTnlGroupName

description: Reversion occurs to this tunnel pair index in a tunnel group
and is used in the trap definition.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlReversionToPairIndex

description: Reversion occurs from this tunnel pair index in a tunnel group
and is used in the trap definition.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-PBT-MIB::cienaCesPbtEncapTnlReversionFromPairIndex
